title: Woman rips necklace off pregnant passenger on packed train in row over seat
text:

Shocking footage has shown the moment a woman ripped a pearl necklace off a pregnant passenger's neck in a row over a seat on a packed London train.

It is believed the vicious row erupted on the Southern Railway train to London Bridge on Thursday, October 10 when the woman asked the pregnant passenger seated next to her to move over and was told to 'lose some weight'.

The women are seen embroiled in a bizarre argument about who is 'bigger' before the attacker viciously tears the pearl necklace off the victim's neck in front of stunned passengers.

When the pregnant woman threatens to call the police and pulls out her phone to take a picture of her attacker, the furious woman attempts to wrestle the mobile phone from her hands.

The woman pleaded with her attacker as they grapple, telling her: "Don't f*****g touch me I'm pregnant!".

Were you on the train? Email webnews@mirror.co.uk

(Image: @alexgalvin7/News Dog Media)

The video was filmed by a fellow commuter after the woman apparently pleaded with passengers to record the video 'for her own sake'.

Footage shows the woman screaming at her victim: "Between me and you who's bigger?" and then being told "I think you".

She then violently rips the necklace off the victim's neck sending pearls flying across the carriage and causing her to scream in shock.

(Image: @alexgalvin7/News Dog Media)

The enraged woman says: "Stupid girl! Don't ever in your life talk to me like that, I asked you politely. It's too early in the morning for you! You're lucky I don't smack you in your face."

A spokesman for Southern Railway said: "There is no place for abusive or threatening behaviour on our services. We urge anyone who witnesses something like this to text the British Transport Police on 61016."

The Met Police have been approached for comment.
description: It is believed the vicious row erupted on the Southern Railway train to London Bridge when the woman asked the pregnant passenger seated next to her to move over and was told to 'lose some weight'
